abstract: Brushes, the iPhone application used to create the June 1 cover of The New Yorker, is flying off the App Store’s virtual shelves.
snippet: Brushes, the iPhone application used to create the June 1 cover of The New Yorker, is flying off the App Store’s virtual shelves.
lead_paragraph: Update | 3:02 p.m.  Post corrected: Mr. Sprang does not work in a coffee shop. He develops applications for the iPhone and Mac full time.

headline.main: New Yorker iPhone Cover Lifts Sales for Brushes App
